pageContext.description: Copper alloy tip of a Bronze Age spearhead. Approximately 35mm of the triangular-shaped tip survives extending back to the extremity of the internal socket, as the central depression from this is extant in the transverse fracture face. In section the much eroded narrow blade wings flank a pronounced circular midrib. The surface of the spear tip has a dark brown to green patina, heavily pock-marked by corrosion pits. Where the patina survives it is marked by parallel longitudinal surface striations, which given their regular nature are most likely from the original finishing process. The fragment is too fragmentary to classify but is probably mid to late Bronze Age circa 1550-800 BC.
